connections at organizationally-defined managed interfaces.  Systems processing, storing, or transmitting PHI:  The organization protects against unauthorized physical connections at those organization-defined managed interfaces necessary to prevent unauthorized physical access, tampering, and theft of PHI.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="System and Communications <priority>1</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>45 C.F.R. ยง164.312(e)(1); 45 C.F.R. ยง164.312(e)(2)(i)</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>PE-4, PE-19, RA-3, SI-12</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>Information systems operating at different security categories or classification levels may share common physical and environmental controls, since the systems may share space within organizational facilities. In practice, it is possible that these separate information systems may share common equipment rooms, wiring closets, and cable distribution paths. Protection against unauthorized physical connections can be achieved, for example, by employing clearly identified and physically separated cable trays, connection frames, and patch panels for each side of managed interfaces with physical access controls enforcing limited authorized access to these items.  Guidance for systems processing, storing, or transmitting PHI:  System interfaces can provide access to the data flows involving PHI. HIPAA has heightened security requirements to protect these interfaces.Under the HIPAA Security Rule, this is an addressable implementation specification. HIPAA covered entities must conduct an analysis as described at 45 C.F.R. ยง 164.306 (Security standards: General rules) part (d) (Implementation specifications) to determine how it must be applied within the organization.</supplemental_guidance> <sys_class_name>x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-19 13:21:30</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>!!!/!!!/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>ee873dfcdb211010280df36f29961990</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-19 13:21:30</sys_updated_on> <task_for/> <time_worked/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1> </record_update>
